sentence.Network_en: The surgeons have been working for twenty hous without letup.
sentence.Network_cn: 那些外科医师一连工作了二十小时没有停止.

sentence.Network_en: They pressed on without letup until they got to the top of the hill.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们一鼓作气爬上山顶.

entry.tran: （通常指令人不快的事情的）缓和，减弱
entry.def: If there is no let-up in something, usually something unpleasant, there is no reduction in the intensity of it.

example.ex: There was no let-up in the battle on the money markets yesterday...
example.tran: 对金融市场的争夺战昨天依然非常激烈。

example.ex: There were no signs of any let-up in job-shedding.
example.tran: 无迹象显示裁员势头会减缓。

means.word_mean: 1. a pause during which things are calm or activities are diminished;

sentences.sentence: "there was never a letup in the noise"

auth_sentence.content: There is little prospect of a letup in fuel shortages for the next few years.
